Description: A hollow terracotta figure of Zeus seated on his eagle, left leg crossed over right. A himation is draped over his head, covering his legs and falling down over the left shoulder. His sceptre rests diagonally against his left shoulder. The plinth is flat-faced and the back plain, except for a raised rim round a circular vent. Two-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt. The eagle is painted yellow with red feet.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased. Said to be from Thebes. Roman, first or second century AD. Comparanda: Close: Bayer-Niemeier 1988: nos 408-10, dated second half of second century AD; Dunand 1990: no. 480-2, the first from Antinoopolis, the others perhaps so, dated second to third century AD; Hilton Price 1897: 401: no. 3323, from the Fayum; Pingiatoglou 1993: no. 60, dated middle of second century AD; Warmenbol 1998: 268, pl. 1:1. Near: Besques 1992: no. D 4504, from Middle Egypt, dated Hellenistic period. Bibliog: Budge 1925: pl. xxviii; Fischer 1994: no. 796.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3324)
